overview.summary: A responsive single-page prototype built to pitch MapleChat, a Canada-only messaging concept focused on privacy and Canadian data residency.
overview.problem: Many messaging platforms store user data outside Canada, creating privacy and compliance concerns for Canadian users.
overview.solution: A clean, static landing page that clearly presents the product concept and links to a Figma chat prototype to support the pitch.

responsibilities: Built the landing page using semantic HTML and custom CSS
Implemented responsive layouts for desktop and mobile
Structured content to clearly communicate the product idea and value
Collaborated with teammates to align content and presentation

architecture.approach: Static single-page prototype built with plain HTML and CSS, optimized for clarity, speed, and easy iteration.
architecture.data_flow: All content is static and organized into clear sections; styles and assets are separated for maintainability.
architecture.deployment: Deployed on GitHub Pages for fast sharing and portfolio review.

key_features: Hero section presenting the core product idea and privacy focus
Hero call-to-action linking to a Figma chat prototype
Feature and FAQ sections supporting the overall pitch
challenges_and_learnings: Communicating a product concept effectively with minimal UI
Making layout and content decisions under time constraints
Aligning design and messaging within a small team
Translating abstract ideas into a clear, usable prototype
future_improvements: Replace placeholders with finalized branding and UI assets
Expand privacy and data residency explanations
Add basic animations for improved presentation
